subtitle: Quick and easy fruity sorbets use canned fruit, so they're cheap and convenient to make.

method.text: Place the peaches and the lemon juice in a food processor or blender. Process until smooth.
Pour into a rigid freezerproof container and stir in the lemon rind. Puree the raspberry until smooth. Pass through a sieve into a separate freezerproof container.
Cover both containers and freeze for 2-1 days until half frozen.
Remove the half frozen pureed mixtures from the freezer. Turn each one out into a mixing bowl. Whisk the egg whites until stiff and divide equally between the 2 bowls.
Using an electric whisk, whisk the egg white into each half-frozen mixture. Return the sorbets to their freezer container. Cover and refreeze.
Transfer the sorbets to the fridge for 10 min to soften before scooping onto serving plates.

title: Speedy fruit sorbets
